description: CSS properties as defined at http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/propidx.html
This differs from the spec in that it has ranges on some numeric

comment: It won't be standardized, and use is strongly discouraged.
There's a very large set of valid values: button, caret, etc.
But use in the wild is mostly just appearance:none.
So we're only allowing 'none' to keep the sanitizer small.
TODO(felix8a): css sanitizer needs a way to allow bare identifiers.

types.signature: <angle> | [[ left-side | far-left | left | center-left | center | center-right | right | far-right | right-side ] || behind ] | leftwards | rightwards

types.comment: affects clipping but does not allow it to exceed bounds of box

signature-comment: signature is the portion of the CSS3 signature
(minus border-image-transform) that is equivalent to CSS2.1 in the
strings matched but not confusing around whether a border applies to
the top only or to the entire box

types.comment: Note the nonstandard name. Used in Firefox 1.0 - 12.0
Note the nonstandard name. Used in Firefox 1.0 - 12.0
Note the nonstandard name. Used in Firefox 1.0 - 12.0
Note the nonstandard name. Used in Firefox 1.0 - 12.0

description: Allow per CSS spec with some exceptions
Reject <counter> because it exposes global page state
Reject attr(<identifier>) because it circumvents Domado attribute value virtualizations
Reject <uri> because, if we accept it, our CSS sanitizers assume any string is a URI
Reject no-open-quote and no-close-quote because they expose a global counter
Reject open-quote and close-quote because we cannot test for them yet
Note that 'inherit' is implicitly allowed, which might be a problem
if some trusted element has 'content' and admits untrusted children
but that's unlikely because 'content' is almost always used on
::before and ::after pseudo-elements, which cannot have children

types.signature: [ [<uri> ,]* [ auto | crosshair | default | pointer | move | e-resize | ne-resize | nw-resize | n-resize | se-resize | sw-resize | s-resize | w-resize | text | wait | help | progress | all-scroll | col-resize | hand | no-drop | not-allowed | row-resize | vertical-text ] ]

inline | block | list-item | run-in | inline-list-item | inline-block | table | inline-table | table-cell | table-caption | flex | inline-flex | grid | inline-grid | [ <display-inside> || <display-outside> || <display-extras> ] | inherit | inline-box | inline-stack
types.comment: inline-box and inline-stack are not in the spec but are recognized.  The <display-box> in the spec is cruft according to email from Tab Atkins

types.signature: block-level | inline-level | none | table-row-group | table-header-group | table-footer-group | table-row | table-cell | table-column-group | table-column | table-caption
[ [ 'font-style' || 'font-variant' || 'font-weight' ]? 'font-size' [ / 'line-height' ]? 'font-family' ] | caption | icon | menu | message-box | small-caption | status-bar
normal | wider | narrower | ultra-condensed | extra-condensed | condensed | semi-condensed | semi-expanded | expanded | extra-expanded | ultra-expanded

types.appliesTo-comment: but non-replaced inline elements, table columns, and column groups.

types.signature: visible | hidden | scroll | auto | no-display | no-content

[ left | center | right | top | bottom | <percentage> | <length> ] | [ left | center | right | <percentage> | <length> ] [ top | center | bottom | <percentage> | <length> ] | [ top | bottom ] [ left | center | right | <percentage> | <length> ]

baseline | sub | super | top | text-top | middle | bottom | text-bottom | <percentage> | <length>
<number:0,> | <percentage:0,> | silent | x-soft | soft | medium | loud | x-loud

[ [ [ <percentage> | <length> | left | center | right ] ] [ [ <percentage> | <length> | top | center | bottom ] ]? | [ [ center | [ left | right ] [ <percentage> | <length> ]? ] || [ center | [ top | bottom ] [ <percentage> | <length> ]? ] ] ]

caveat: Font names containing any such characters or whitespace
If quoting is omitted, any whitespace characters before
and after the font name are ignored and any sequence of
whitespace characters inside the font name is converted to
a single space. Font family names that happen to be the
and 'cursive') must be quoted to prevent confusion with
the keywords with the same names.

description: Space separated words that should be quoted.
The validator contains a separate pass that finds adjacent loose
words and turns them into a single quoted term.
Subsequent words need not be unreserved since a 'font-family'
cannot be followed directly by a reserved keyword.

types.description: A URI that is resolved relative to the base URL of the document containing the styled node, not the containing stylesheet.

types.signature: [ <percentage>  |  <length>  |  [[ left | right ] [ <percentage> | <length> ]? [ center | [ top | bottom ] [ <percentage> | <length> ]? ]? ]  |  [ [ top | bottom ] [ <percentage> | <length> ]? [ center | [ left | right ] [ <percentage> | <length> ]? ]? ]  |  [ center [ center | [ left | right | top | bottom ] [ <percentage> | <length> ]? ]? ] ]
types.comment: the signature was derived from the source by duplicating and reducing to avoid the use of the && operator defined in http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/about.html#property-defs which is not supported by the CSS whitelist parser.

types.signature: ease | linear | ease-in | ease-out | ease-in-out | step-start | step-end | steps(<integer>[, [ start | end ] ]?) | cubic-bezier(<number>, <number>, <number>, <number>)

translate(<translation-value>[, <translation-value>]) | translateX(<translation-value>) | translateY(<translation-value>) | scale(<number>[, <number>]) | scaleX(<number>) | scaleY(<number>) | rotate(<angle>) | skew(<angle>[, <angle>]) | skewX(<angle>) | skewY(<angle>)

translate3d(<translation-value>, <translation-value>, <length>) | translateZ(<length>) | scale3d(<number>, <number>, <number>) | scaleZ(<number>) | rotate3d(<number>, <number>, <number>, <angle>) | rotateX(<angle>) | rotateY(<angle>) | rotateZ(<angle>) | perspective(<length>)

types.comment: 6 number version is a 2D transform matrix, and the 16 number version is the full 3-D transform matrix.
